elements.name: has_succession_plan_in_place
elements.title: Do you have a succession plan in place?
elements.description: Succession planning is about future proofing your business. Whether you are seeking to remove yourself from the day-to-day running of the business, considering selling at some point in the future, or just planning long term for your retirement, succession planning is critical to your continuity of your business.

elements.name: succession_plan_proactive_implementation
elements.title: Is the plan being proactively implemented?

elements.name: succession_plan_effectiveness
elements.title: Is the plan working?

elements.name: succession_plan_for_business_continuity
elements.title: In the interests of business continuity and risk planning, is there someone on your current team who could take over your role in the event of death, illness or incapacity to continue.

elements.name: family_members_operating
elements.title: Are any family members operating a similar business in close proximity to this business

elements.title: Do you believe all directors share the business's goals and vision?

elements.title: Do you run internal team meetings?

elements.title: How often do you run internal team meetings?

elements.name: run_divisional_mgmt_meetings
elements.title: Do you run management meetings within your divisions?
choices: We don't run management meetings at all

elements.name: mgmt_meetings_frequency
elements.visibleIf: {run_divisional_mgmt_meetings} allof ['Yes in every division', 'Yes for some divisions']
elements.title: How often do you run management meetings?
elements.description: Please select as many as relevant. As an example, you may run meetings monthly in one division, while another runs them weekly. In such a case you would select both the weekly and the monthly options.

elements.name: mgmt_meetings_tools
elements.visibleIf: {run_divisional_mgmt_meetings} allof ['Yes in every division', 'Yes for some divisions']
elements.title: Which of the following do you use as part of managing these meetings?
elements.description: Select as many as are relevant.

elements.name: runs_divisional_team_meetings
elements.title: Do you run team meetings within these divisions?
choices: We don't run team meetings at all

elements.name: team_meetings_frequency
elements.visibleIf: {runs_divisional_team_meetings} allof ['Yes in every division', 'Yes for some divisions']
elements.title: How often do you run team meetings?
elements.description: Please select as many as relevant. As an example, you may run meetings monthly in one division, while another runs them weekly. In such a case you would select both the weekly and the monthly options.

elements.name: team_meetings_tools
elements.visibleIf: {runs_divisional_team_meetings} allof ['Yes in every division', 'Yes for some divisions']
elements.title: Which of the following do you use as part of managing these meetings? Select as many as are relevant.

elements.name: senior_mgmt_strategy_review_frequency
elements.title: How often does your senior management from all divisions get together to review business reports, business information, talk big picture strategy etc. with the senior executives/owners of the business?

elements.name: sr_mgmt_strategy_review_tools
elements.title: Which of the following do you use as part of managing these meetings? Select as many as are relevant.

elements.name: next_2_years_invest_more
elements.title: In the next 2 years we will need to invest more resources (money, people, time, machinery, equipment, space m2 etc.) into our manufacturing or production capacity

elements.name: util_production_equip
elements.title: What is the utilisation of your current production equipment? Meaning of 'Utilisation' in this instance:  The amount of time that equipment are being used for productive work. 100% is full capacity, fully utilised. 50% for example refers to equipment being used half the available time allocated to productive work, and in theory then have more capacity to produce.

elements.name: util_manufacturing_facility
elements.title: What is the utilisation of your current manufacturing facility? Meaning of 'Utilisation' in this instance:  The amount of space that is being used in your manufacturing facility for productive work. 100% is full capacity, fully utilised. 50% for example refers to only half the space being used for productive work, and in theory  there is more space to expand into.

elements.name: util_manufacturing_team
elements.title: What is the utilisation of your current manufacturing team? Meaning of 'Utilisation' in this instance:  The amount of time that the team's available hours are being used for productive work. 100% is full capacity, fully utilised. 50% for example refers to the team being used half the available time allocated to productive work and in theory they have more capacity to produce.

elements.name: busy_rating

Our staff are not performing well

elements.name: team_cohesion_satisfaction
elements.title: Are you happy that your team is cohesive, interdependent, supportive of each other and functioning at the optimum level?

elements.name: measured_hr_data_types
elements.title: Which data do you measure?

elements.name: percentage_chance_of_losing_key_customers
elements.title: If one or more owners were to leave the business, what is the estimated risk (%) that the business would lose key customers?
elements.description: Please provide the percentage (%) that applies, with 0% indicating absolutely no chance of any customers leaving, and 100% indicating that the business will with 100% certainty lose key customers should you leave the business.

elements.title: Does the business use this CRM system proactively and effectively? Please rate out of 10

elements.title: What percentage (%) of your total revenue do your top 3 customers account for?

elements.title: The number of major customers (A major customer means any customer whose combined custom accounts for 5% or more of the total annual sales revenue of the business)

elements.name: premises_update_needed
elements.title: Do your physical premises, be it office, warehouse etc require any updating in terms of external appeal (such as new paint or logo refreshment etc.)?
elements.description: The reality is the people do 'judge the book by its cover',meaning that if your office or retail premise for example looks outdated, perhaps your logo is peeling off the sign or is faded, then those in themselves will affect the perception people will have of your business.

elements.name: main_competitor_analysis

elements.description: Qualify them using these as the guide: Size (Bigger, Smaller, Same). Prices (More Expensive, Less Expensive, Same). Quality (Better, Worse, Same). Strengths (e.g. part of buying group, good sales team, great reputation, very active marketing, well established etc). Weaknesses (e.g. poor reputation, poor range, no sales team, fail to adapt to market etc).
